intro: Saccularia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth saccularia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Sarcodactylaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Saccularia glabrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
